strategies.name: Replacement Template
strategies.description: Replace a symbol associated with a trait with the subject in a context where that trait is essential

operations.name: identify_trait
operations.instruction: Identify the key trait T of subject P that should be highlighted

operations.name: find_symbol
operations.instruction: Find a symbol S that is universally associated with trait T

operations.name: create_context
operations.instruction: Create a context where trait T is essential for S to function

operations.name: replace
operations.instruction: Replace S with P in this context

strategies.example: To showcase Nike-Air's shock absorption, replace a firefighter's life net (symbol of shock absorption) with the shoe in a rescue scenario

strategies.name: Forced Connections
strategies.description: Create novel ideas by connecting two unrelated concepts or domains that have not been previously associated

operations.name: select_domains
operations.instruction: Identify your primary domain and select a distant, unrelated domain

operations.name: map_elements
operations.instruction: Identify key elements, principles, or structures in both domains

operations.name: transfer_elements
operations.instruction: Transfer elements from the random domain to the primary domain

operations.name: synthesize
operations.instruction: Create a coherent synthesis incorporating elements from both domains

strategies.example: To create a novel children's toy, combine principles of quantum physics (uncertainty, superposition) with traditional playground equipment - resulting in a 'Quantum Playground' where slides have multiple possible endpoints that aren't determined until a child reaches them

strategies.name: Assumption Reversal
strategies.description: Identify core assumptions in a domain and systematically reverse or challenge them to generate unexpected ideas

operations.name: list_assumptions
operations.instruction: Identify fundamental assumptions or 'rules' in the domain you're exploring

operations.name: select_assumption
operations.instruction: Choose the most fundamental or taken-for-granted assumption

operations.name: reverse_assumption
operations.instruction: Reverse this assumption or imagine it doesn't exist

operations.name: explore_consequences
operations.instruction: Develop a practical idea based on this reversal

strategies.example: In restaurant design, reverse the assumption that 'customers come to the restaurant' - create a concept where the restaurant comes to customers, not just delivery but the entire dining experience configurable in any location

strategies.name: SCAMPER Transformation
strategies.theory_base: Alex Osborn and Bob Eberle's SCAMPER Technique
strategies.description: Transform existing concepts by applying targeted operations from the SCAMPER framework (Substitute, Combine, Adapt, Modify/Magnify, Put to other uses, Eliminate, Reverse)

operations.name: select_base
operations.instruction: Select a base concept, product, or service to transform

operations.name: choose_operations
operations.instruction: Select 2-3 SCAMPER operations that seem most promising (Substitute, Combine, Adapt, Modify, Purpose, Eliminate, or Reverse)

operations.name: apply_operations
operations.instruction: Apply your chosen operations to transform the base concept

operations.name: synthesize
operations.instruction: Integrate the transformations into a coherent new concept

strategies.example: Transforming a traditional umbrella: Substitute fabric with solar panels, combine with smartphone charging, reverse so it collects water instead of repelling it - creating a multi-functional device that both protects from rain and harvests energy/water

strategies.name: Conceptual Blending
strategies.theory_base: Fauconnier and Turner's Conceptual Blending Theory
strategies.description: Merge two conceptual spaces to create an emergent structure with properties that neither input space contains

operations.name: select_inputs
operations.instruction: Select two distinct but potentially complementary conceptual spaces

operations.name: map_crossspace
operations.instruction: Identify correspondences and shared structures between the input spaces

operations.name: blend_selectively
operations.instruction: Selectively project elements from both inputs into a blended space

operations.name: develop_emergent
operations.instruction: Develop the unique emergent properties that arise in the blended space

strategies.example: Blending 'tree' and 'database' conceptual spaces to create a 'knowledge tree' visualization where data grows organically, has seasonal cycles of revision, and produces 'fruits' of insight when branches of information connect in new ways

strategies.name: Distance Association
strategies.theory_base: Margaret Boden's Conceptual Spaces and Ronald Finke's Geneplore Model
strategies.description: Generate ideas by creating associations between concepts at varying levels of semantic distance, prioritizing medium-distance associations

operations.name: anchor_concept
operations.instruction: Establish the central concept you're working with

operations.name: generate_associations
operations.instruction: Generate concepts at varying distances from the anchor (near, medium, far)

operations.name: select_medium
operations.instruction: Select medium-distance concepts that are not obvious but still connectable

operations.name: develop_association
operations.instruction: Create a meaningful connection between the anchor and the medium-distance concept

strategies.example: Starting with 'coffee shop' as the anchor: Near concepts (caf√©, barista) are too obvious; Far concepts (quantum physics, deep sea) are too disconnected; Medium concepts (theater, ritual, garden) have creative potential - leading to a 'performance coffee shop' where brewing is theatrical and customers participate in the process

strategies.name: Oblique Strategies
strategies.theory_base: Brian Eno and Peter Schmidt's Oblique Strategies Cards
strategies.description: Overcome creative blocks by applying random, often paradoxical or lateral constraints that force new perspectives on a problem

operations.name: draw_random_card
operations.instruction: Select a random cryptic directive such as 'Honor thy error as a hidden intention,' 'Use an old idea,' or 'What would your closest friend do?'

operations.name: interpret_directive
operations.instruction: Interpret how this seemingly unrelated directive could apply to your problem

operations.name: apply_insight
operations.instruction: Apply the resulting insight to develop an unexpected solution

strategies.example: When designing a new music composition interface, drawing the card 'Use an unacceptable color' led to creating an interface where 'wrong' notes are embraced rather than corrected, resulting in a system that encourages musical exploration and happy accidents
